poem:
Title: A Song of Silent Wires

Beneath the frosty gaze of UK's reign,
Meddling meets an unexpected bane.
The Telegraph, in static whispers, waits,
Immobility, the fruit of legal gates.
UAE-backed shadows stir the quill,
yet Lucy's word holds firm the still.
In hushed halls - a newspaper's fate,
where ink and ambitions tessellate.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Telegraph takeover: UK issues ‘stop meddling’ order to UAE-backed consortium The UK government has issued a legal order stopping a UAE-backed consortium from meddling with the Telegraph, including making any changes to top management and editorial executives, until investigations into its proposed takeover are complete. Lucy Frazer, the culture secretary, issued the pre-emptive action order after RedBird IMI’s last-minute move to create a new UK holding company to house the Telegraph and the Spectator if". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Telegraph takeover: UK issues ‘stop meddling’ order to UAE-backed consortium The UK government has issued a legal order stopping a UAE-backed consortium from meddling with the Telegraph, including making any changes to top management and editorial executives, until investigations into its proposed takeover are complete. Lucy Frazer, the culture secretary, issued the pre-emptive action order after RedBird IMI’s last-minute move to create a new UK holding company to house the Telegraph and the Spectator if
